title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy
text: The Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) for a process can be calculated using the following equation:\n\nΔG $$=$$ ΔH - $$T \Delta S$$

title: Know the Units for Enthalpy and Entropy
text: Since ΔH is given in $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and ΔS is in $$\frac{J}{mol} K$$, make sure to convert ΔH to the same unit as ΔS by multiplying with $$1000$$. This way, both energy terms will be in Joules.

title: Convert Enthalpy to Joules
text: Calculate ΔH in Joules instead of kJ:\n\nΔH $$=$$ $$40.79$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ * $$1000$$ $$\frac{J}{kJ}$$ $$=$$ ?

title: Calculate Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: Using the equation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - $$T \Delta S$$, substitute values:\n\nΔG $$=$$ $$40790$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ - $$350$$ K * $$109.5$$ $$\frac{J}{mol} K$$ $$=$$ ?
